Reviews.Title: good cheap secondary keyboard
Reviews.Author: robmic
Reviews.Content: Very cheap ($7) and everything worked straight out of the box. The enter key is slightly different than most modern keyboard layouts, but I dont mind it since I dont use the keyboard all the time.Product picture is a little deceiving because it does not come with a mouse.

Reviews.Title: Nice keyboard - Compatible with MacBook Pro
Reviews.Author: JMM

logTag.type = "text/javascript"; logTag.src = "/gp/customer-media/du/log.html?ie=UTF8&p=CustomerImage&s=CustomerVideoPlay"; head[0].appendChild(logTag); } if (cv_moH6GQBDC2PI03currentClick) { return cv_moH6GQBDC2PI03currentClick(); } } } Length:: 0:30 MinsThis keyboard works perfectly and seems to be well made. I wasn't sure if it would work with Mac products, but fortunately it works fine on my MacBook Pro laptop. I purchased it as a secondary keyboard to the one on my laptop, the number pad on this keyboard is good for accounting and spreadsheets - it's much better than the long "row" of numbers on the Macbook Pro's setup.The first time you plug this keyboard into your computer's USB port, there is a quick keyboard configuration that requires you to press a few of the keys to ensure it is properly calibrated. After that, the keyboard is ready to go. The keys are nice and have just the right amount of resistance. The USB cord is long enough to accommodate just about any scenario.*NOTE: At the time of this review, the product photos show both a keyboard and a mouse. But this purchase includes only a keyboard, there is no mouse.

Reviews.Title: could be me
Reviews.Author: Chris M. Wollesen
Reviews.Content: My review might not be the same for everyone and it's really my fault for not looking more at the picture, but the keyboard layout isn't exactly standard.  look carefully at your existing keyboard or the desired keyboard layout before buying this one.  Look at the enter key and the backslash key locations.  I always end up hitting enter at the wrong time.

Reviews.Title: Really Nice Keyboard
Reviews.Author: Rajesh
Reviews.Content: This is really a nice keyboard.  I would say not great, because the keys are not so smooth, but are okay.  A little bit noisy especially space bar.  Another thing I don't like is the layout of Home,End,Insert,Delete,PgUp and PgDown keys which is different from what I am used to.  However I can get adjusted to that.I would say this is a really nice keyboard for an affordable price.

Reviews.Title: good buy
Reviews.Author: capt.insane
Reviews.Content: it works like any other keyboard. Its sleek design will make guests notice. I recently caught my roommate slowly stroking the keys in a provocative manner. Then he smelled it.

Reviews.Title: Arrived Chipped, Works Fine
Reviews.Author: Xarphael
Reviews.Content: Mine arrived with a sizable chip broken off of one of the corners. Only the plastic is broken- nothing is damaged inside, and for the price I'm not going to bother with an exchange. Works fine otherwise, but is a bit flimsy.

Reviews.Title: the KEY to a basic computer.
Reviews.Author: Mike In San Diego
Reviews.Content: I needed a replacement for an older system that I am refurbishing that uses PS/2 for the keyboard.  Once done, I can give it to someone that wanted a "beginner" system.great price for a 'giveaway" system.

Reviews.Title: Basic keyboard and mouse that works
Reviews.Author: Carl Hilton
Reviews.Content: I wanted a basic keyboard and mouse for simplicity and this filled the bill.I recommend this product for this purpose.

Reviews.Title: Terrible construction.
Reviews.Author: Robert W. Baker
Reviews.Content: The keyboard bends when laying your hands on it. In fact you can twist it like a sponge. The keys stick on fast typing.

Reviews.Title: ok
Reviews.Author: Ic
Reviews.Content: it didn't quite work with my computer that's connected to TV, but it worked with my laptop. couldn't figure out why...but it works.

Reviews.Title: Good deal. Great slim keyboard!
Reviews.Author: adrian
Reviews.Content: This V7 Slim keyboard is great!  The brushed black metal look is stylish. It was very easy to install (mine just plugged in and it worked!)and its very slim!  The overall size is much smaller than my old Dell USB multimedia keyboard and is sturdier with a much nicer finish than my Logitech BT multimedia keyboard!  It even has a few buttons neither of my old ones had.  The wrist rest is a nice touch and helps elevate my hands while typing for a very ergonomic/natural feel.  Although it looks large because of the wrist rest the keys are in a "compact" configuration and its smaller than most multimedia keyboards.  Overall, this is a great buy and I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: USER ERROR_CHANGE REVIEW 1st STRIKE - NO USB CONNECTION
Reviews.Author: Abel R Ruiz
Reviews.Content: EDIT CHANGE NOV 19TH--MANUFACTURER ERROR NOT TELLING CUSTOMERS WHERE TO LOCATE USB CONNECTOR. EMBEDDED WITHIN MOUSE- DIRECTIONS WOULD HAVE HELPED. PRODUCT WORKS WELL WITH NO PROBLEMS FOR 2 WKS SO FAR ..BUT FRUSTRATION TRYING TO LOCATE USB. AMAZON EXCELLENT REPLACING SET ETC. .....Needed this product badly and paid extra for expedited delivery. Product delivered next day but the missing USB connector made the product useless. Waiting to see how fast Amazon will replace this item ---Keep this type of quality control by manufacturer in mind.

Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for.
Reviews.Author: F. Zupancic
Reviews.Content: I bought two of these, one for my second computer at home, and one for my work computer. The one at home is fine and reliable, but the one at work has the E key sporadically working/not working.You get what you pay for, and frankly I'm too lazy to bother with a refund for this. It was only like $6-7, anyway. However, a little quality control or product testing would be nice.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Kevin
Reviews.Content: This keyboard and mouse works great. I use it for my laptop. The usb receiver is very small and works for both the keyboard and mouse.

Reviews.Title: Pretty Awesome
Reviews.Author: Blake London
Reviews.Content: cant beat this combo for the price. the only thing that is worthy of complaint is that the shift ( at least on mine) is a little sticky at time, but its not bad.  Very solid and quiet. I use it for gaming and it works great. Would recommend!!

Reviews.Title: Great Price - small keyboard
Reviews.Author: Manuel
Reviews.Content: Its a great keyboard for the price. The only reason I am not giving it 5 stars is that the keyboard would be much better if it were a little bigger. The keys are not spread out enough.

Reviews.Title: Ad advertised
Reviews.Author: David G. Powell "greenpentacle"
Reviews.Content: No problems and works as advertised. Nice lightweight keyboard, and very inexpensive. It is a good deal for the money.

Reviews.Title: The price is right
Reviews.Author: Ian Lasley
Reviews.Content: Works as advertised. Can't complain and the price is right!To the people that's says it feels cheap. No kidding it is a $7 keyboard.

Reviews.Title: V7
Reviews.Author: Danny543
Reviews.Content: iTS A KEYBOARD. wHAT ELSE DO YOU EXPECT? LOL A REVIEW FOR THIS ITEM IS EXTRMELY IRRELEVANT AND VERY UNECESSARY.

Reviews.Title: No Comment
Reviews.Author: Jerome L Blafer
Reviews.Content: Keyboard arrive on time. Cannot comment on it since I only bought it because it was cheap and I was using it as a trade-in that gave me more money for it than I paid.

Reviews.Title: What is Standard?
Reviews.Author: N S Munn
Reviews.Content: If you are in the US then you probably are used to an ANSI layout.  If you are in the UK you may be used to ISO layout.  I am in the US and I found this keyboard too different to use for work.  If you are just using it to control a seldom used terminal then it will likely suffice.  If you use a keyboard eight hours a day and do it by touch this will bother you.So to be clear this is an ISO Standard Keyboard not ANSI.

Reviews.Title: not bad
Reviews.Author: TALL MAN
Reviews.Content: always can use an extra basic key board & for the money this dose what we needed,  works fine, looks fine, so we got our moneys worth.  i would recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: V7 Standard USB Keyboard
Reviews.Author: Affordable Computers
Reviews.Content: Arrived fast and safe.Needed something inexpensive to work on PC's with.It does the job so well I put one on my own system.

Reviews.Title: A great keyboard at a great price
Reviews.Author: Montalguy
Reviews.Content: This keyboard performs exactly as stated.  Although it is lightweight and slightly smaller than previous keyboards, it is highly functional.

Reviews.Title: Product is great
Reviews.Author: Kevin P.
Reviews.Content: This keyboard design is excellent. My fingers can't get away from it! The sleek design goes well with my monitor!

Reviews.Title: An ordinary keyboard
Reviews.Author: jlwinste
Reviews.Content: This is a basic keyboard and it does what it is supposed to do.  The keys feel fine, but I am concerned that it may not be sturdy enough to hold up for very long.  We'll see. . .

Reviews.Title: great standard keys and mouse
Reviews.Author: lolrofl
Reviews.Content: needed this for my office kvm. great standard keys. would purchase again and again and again and again and again.

Reviews.Title: Works as advertised
Reviews.Author: Jim
Reviews.Content: Plugged it in and it worked great. I had a notebook and the key board stopped working and now i can use it again.

Reviews.Title: To each their own
Reviews.Author: David Courtney "blixel"
Reviews.Content: My rating of this keyboard is probably unfair, but let me explain why I'm only giving it 1 star. First of all, there was nothing technically wrong with the keyboard. It's an inexpensive PS/2 keyboard and is most definitely a great value. For anyone who actually likes the layout out of the Enter/Backslash key, and the odd layout of the Home/End/Insert/Delete, then I would say go ahead and buy this keyboard. It is a fantastic value.The positioning and size of certain keys on a keyboard make such a huge difference in my typing. I hate keyboards that have a small backspace key. In fact, the reason I came to Amazon to find a new keyboard was to replace an old PS/2 keyboard I have (which otherwise works perfectly), but has a small backspace key. Every time I reach for the backspace key on that keyboard, I instead end up pressing the key to the immediate left of the backspace key.So I came to Amazon and did a quick search for "PS2 keyboards." When I saw this V7 keyboard, and saw that it had the double-sized backspace key (which I consider standard/normal), I immediately ordered it without a second look.Mistake.Unfortunately the positioning of the Enter and Backslash key on this V7 keyboard is completely foreign to me. I am CONSTANTLY hitting the backslash key while trying to press Enter. And when I actually want to press backslash, I am instead hitting the Enter key.I only needed this as a secondary keyboard for an extra computer, so I thought I could live with it.But I can't. It simply isn't worth the aggravation. It's at least as irritating as having the small backspace key. So I solved one problem, but created a new problem that was equally irksome.I suppose I blame myself for not paying closer attention to the layout of the keys. For just a couple of dollars more, I found 2 other PS/2 keyboards here at Amazon. One by Microsoft - the "Microsoft Wired Keyboard 200", and one by Logitech - the "Logitech Keyboard K120". Both of those have, what I consider to be, "normal" keyboard layouts.For my own sanity, this V7 keyboard isn't worth the headache.

Reviews.Title: Very nice replacement only issue is that the
Reviews.Author: Steve Herndon
Reviews.Content: Very nice replacement only issue is that the , is printed as a ; on the keyboard.  If you are a touch typist it is not an issue.

Reviews.Title: no problems with this keyboard.
Reviews.Author: Pen Name
Reviews.Content: I  got this keyboard for my mom to replace her old keyboard.  It shipped quickly, and was easy to plug in/install.  The price was good.

Reviews.Title: Fair Quality - Weird Format
Reviews.Author: MastroDamus
Reviews.Content: The quality is fair but the format and key placement of the keys is very weird for any qualified typist.

Reviews.Title: cheap keyboard
Reviews.Author: dee doo
Reviews.Content: This keyboard works just fine and is dirt cheap. It's pretty small and slim for such a cheap keyboard and the keys are nice and springy. However, the keys are loud and have a hollow feel. When I type on this keyboard it can be noisy, which I don't mind but may be annoying to some. It seems responsive enough for casual gaming, and has held up to light/moderate use for two years. (But is definitely not a gamer's keyboard.)

Reviews.Title: Not bad, but not great
Reviews.Author: D. Jensen
Reviews.Content: I bought this for temporary use in close quarters. It works fine and is well worth the cost. Tactile sensation  and response is only fair. I do not regret the purchase and am keeping it for a spare.

Reviews.Title: very good for the price - KM0Z1
Reviews.Author: Henzo Broquee "HB"
Reviews.Content: surprised how heavy it is, I was expecting something flimsier. and the keys and keysprings feel great, for a chiclet keyboard. (I had gotten used to amazon basics boards which are also not bad for the price. but they are pretty light and flimsy, and the keys and springs/feedback feel quite cheap. but not so on this v7 kbd!)all I wanted was an inexpensive usb keyboard with a sleep key on it (amazon firetv does not have a power button. it will time out and eventually sleep if you are not using it. but a keyboard with a sleep key will let you make it sleep immediately.)does exactly what I want and it's much better made than I expected, so I'm happy. we'll just have to see how durable it is...

Reviews.Title: sometimes dosen't register keystrokes
Reviews.Author: Amber
Reviews.Content: The Mouse works but keyboard has issues I think I will just stay with my usb keyboard.It could be my ps/2 ports but I doubt it.

Reviews.Title: Edited review from 2 stars to 4 - I got used to it.
Reviews.Author: Graham
Reviews.Content: I originally had a pretty negative review with two stars. However after a few days of gaming, I got used to the very rubber dome feel and the enter and slash keys (They're the wrong place). The keyboard and mouse feels very cheap but they work fine.Pro:- Dirt cheap (Got it for less than $12 with shipping and tax)- Works how it's supposed toCons:- Keyboard enter and backslash key are not in the correct layout  and makes it feel a bit awkward (You do get used to it but it's a bit weird)- Pretty loud mouse click- Keyboard feels very membraney- Feels cheap (Then again, it's >$12!)Conclusion: I build a very cheap "gaming" rig. This was so cheap that all the cons don't matter much and you get used to the weird layout of the keys. I will upgrade to a mechanical keyboard when I have 10 times the money that I used to buy this.

Reviews.Title: Okay keyboard
Reviews.Author: Tyler Hartt
Reviews.Content: Alright so I bought this keyboard to be a cheap as possible replacement until I buy my higher end mechanical keyboard.It arrived well packaged and in good shape, I also like the logo on the keyboard it looks pretty cool.Few notes:-the picture makes it look nicer than it really is, you'll be slightly disappointed if you compare the two, must be the lighting.-it feels slightly cheap and the keys aren't super pleasing to press down, you'll make typos if you're used to something more expensive.  There isn't much feedback.The enter key is in a weird place, I read this review before I bought it but it really is awkward, will take a minute to get used to.-Went down a lot of words per second from my last keyboard.-This isn't a standard keyboard you'd find in a computer lab or a school, it is definitely cheaper.  I thought it would be more like that.But hey, for $7 how can you really beat it?  If you need something for a quick replacement for a few days and you don't want to blow too much money it isn't a bad option, if you're on a really extreme budget as well.  If you spend more than 1-2 hours on the computer a day though I'd advise just shelling out for something a bit nicer.

Reviews.Title: inexpensive keyboard
Reviews.Author: Leslie G. Stewart "Curmudgeon"
Reviews.Content: I needed a keyboard for a desktop pc that I put together for my grandson and one to use for testing computers on the work bench. I didn't want to spend a lot of money either. This turned out to be perfect! The first thing I noticed out of the box was that it was flimsy but on a desk it is fine and works as well as any keyboard I have ever used. I like it very much and you can't go wrong at this price!

Reviews.Title: Perfect
Reviews.Author: Eric Enloe
Reviews.Content: Allows my wife to use her laptop as a desktop.  Keyboard works the way we need and comfortable to type on.

Reviews.Title: The Product Works Great
Reviews.Author: fitofone
Reviews.Content: The keyboard and mouse arrived in one box on time and without any damages. Really cheap combo and really easy to use.

Reviews.Title: PS2 for ten dollars!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Jeremiah S.
Reviews.Content: I just needed to get on my old computer, and needed a cheap PS2 keyboard.It kind of upset me to see several reviews saying this keyboard felt cheap.  IT IS CHEAP!!!!!  I do not pay ten dollars hoping to get twenty, but in this case I feel I at least got more than ten.It works well.  However, note that the pins on the plug are very easily bent.  I tried to plug it in by feel, and when I twisted the plug to find the notch, it twisted all the pins to the right.  Had to bend them back, works great, and I am to blame, so I definitely would recommend this to someone who needs a cheap keyboard for an old PS2 computer.

Reviews.Title: Standard USB Keyboard.
Reviews.Author: Ogre "Shrek"
Reviews.Content: It's a keyboard.  Nothing fancy but it works well.  The price is right! Non of the extra clunky crap.  Just a solid, basic keyboard.  I will purchase more.

Reviews.Title: works good
Reviews.Author: Arlington PC Repair
Reviews.Content: Works great as ti should, everything is good. What more is there to say? price was good, product is good.

Reviews.Title: Nothing special, but it works well
Reviews.Author: drewtwo99
Reviews.Content: It's cheap, it works, it detects quickly, and has a decently long cable.There's nothing really to rave about this keyboard, but for a cheap option it's quite satisfactory.No issues at all so far with keys not working, falling off, etc. Had it for a few weeks and it's holding up well, even after being dropped a few times.

Reviews.Title: Weird keyboard
Reviews.Author: Cee
Reviews.Content: I don't like this keyboard,it freezes my screen and i have trouble scrolling. The mouse was not clamped shut before the screw was put in so I had to force it shut using a nail file. I am now stuck using my onscreen keyboard,not a happy customer!

Reviews.Title: Great for the price
Reviews.Author: Martin Kosarik
Reviews.Content: I just wanted a simple, no frills keyboard...this is it. It's just the right size. The keys push down smoothly, don't "click" (I hate that). There are no bells and whistles but I didn't want any. I wanted INEXPENSIVE but not cheap...and that's what this is.

Reviews.Title: Great cheap keyboad. does the job and everyone is happy.We have bought 20 here with no failures.
Reviews.Author: Help Desk
Reviews.Content: Cant go wrong with this keyboard unless you need additional features or USB  hub built in. The matching mouse is great too.

Reviews.Title: Not good quality
Reviews.Author: Minh D Nguyen
Reviews.Content: this is a defective keyboard, and i can not use,so it cost me time and make me confused. never buy a refurbished item again

Reviews.Title: Excellent price, don't like the layout too much.
Reviews.Author: Mc Floyd
Reviews.Content: I wasn't aware of how much I was used to the regular US-101 Keyboards until I got this one. The layout is just not the best. I'm getting used to it (got it back in Jan, 20, 2014), but I'm not as productive as I am with a regular kb.Pros:*very nice price*slim*nice color*good keys size*multimedia controls at the bottomCons:*not the best quality (TBD how long it lasts)*not the best layout*Doesn't have global forward/backward buttons. You have to focus on iTunes or Windows MP in order to move forward or *backward the songs.*extra backspace key in key-pad makes me delete chars when I'm trying to place a - (again, this is due to the layout)*Material is not the best quality and keys move in their place

Reviews.Title: Good keyboard, free's up 1 USB slot
Reviews.Author: Alan Toaca
Reviews.Content: I mainly got this because I wanted to free up 1 USB slot on a desktop computer. Works great with any operating system and the price is great. Shipping was fast and packaging was good, keyboard is pretty stiff but that's a good thing. It doesn't feel "cheaply made."I'd buy it again if I needed a PS/2 keyboard. 5/5

Reviews.Title: Definitely cheap
Reviews.Author: Jerrica Docter
Reviews.Content: This keyboard and mouse combo are definitely cheaply made.  You can tell as soon as you use them.  However, the price reflects that and so far they work sufficiently well.

Reviews.Title: Simple, elegant, and excelent
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I was not expecting such high quality from a simple keyboard. I am able to use this on multiple flavors of the raspberry pi and beagel bone operating systems as well as my windows machine. Not needing additional drivers are a plus, especially if internet access is difficult on first boot.

Reviews.Title: Its good for what it does
Reviews.Author: Nick Nelson
Reviews.Content: I purchased this keyboard only as a backup whenever my computer decides to not want to read the usb ports. Works as intended.

Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for.
Reviews.Author: Jill Carlson "Daycare Mom"
Reviews.Content: You get what you pay for when you're buying this keyboard. It is cheap, feels cheap, but will probably last forever. If I could adjust one thing on this keyboard it would be that the "Enter" key was larger.

Reviews.Title: ps/2 keyboard
Reviews.Author: T. Mascarello
Reviews.Content: I needed a ps/2 keyboard for our Sony 400 CD Player to enter artist's names etc. I have extra usb keyboards but they wouldn't work with an adapter. This keyboard, ps/2 works great. Just what I needed to enter information on my Sony.  Also, with Prime membership, this showed up two days after I ordered it, no shipping!!

Reviews.Title: What Do You Do When The Letters Wear Off?
Reviews.Author: Jim in California
Reviews.Content: You get a new keyboard. This keyboard and mouse are on my "old" XP computer. The "old" box is not connected to the net but has software that is easier to use than the stuff on my "new" Windows 7. This keyboard is smaller than my old one and the mouse seems to slide better, so this is a good deal.

Reviews.Title: Great Deal on a Keyboard & Mouse Combo!
Reviews.Author: Lefti ELM
Reviews.Content: This is a great Deal!  Seller gave good communications & good shipping speed. The only slight problem I've experienced is that the Mouse Sticks sometimes when I Left Click it, but I can live with that!  I recommend this Seller & this Product if you're looking for a PC Keyboard & Mouse!

Reviews.Title: Works as advertised
Reviews.Author: Katherine H.
Reviews.Content: Needed a plug and play PS/2 keyboard for PC building. Works perfectly for the function. No real bells and whistles to it, just a good functional keyboard.

Reviews.Title: FED EX IS NOT USPS GET IT STRAIGHT!
Reviews.Author: Scott A Smith
Reviews.Content: I waited for a long time to get it,but its great. You cant find PS2 connectors anymore. The problem was the shipping! It was sentFed Ex but when I wasn't home they switched to USPS without telling me. It ended up at the local post office but said it was"out fordelivery.  Two weekslater I tried the post office and it had been sitting there for TWO WEEKS> Not GOOD!If If your shipping FED EXSHIP FED EX. If you ship USPS ship USPS don't change vendors without notifying the customer! THIS WHOLE THING SUCKSNO STARS IS MORE LIKE IT!

Reviews.Title: A little sturdier then the standard 10 dollar keyboard
Reviews.Author: PhantomWraith
Reviews.Content: This keyboard responds nicely and does seem to be thicker then the standard cheap keyboard. The Quality on this one is a little higher then the average low cost keyboard. It is window's ready and doesn't need a driver to run. the Keys have a firm spring in them and seems it would last some time before needing to be replaced and for a guy that's on his computer at least 8 hours a day hammering keys for game's that's a nice statement.

Reviews.Title: V7 PS/2 Desktop Keyboard (KC0D2-5N6) V7
Reviews.Author: IOAN P.
Reviews.Content: V7 PS/2 Desktop Keyboard (KC0D2-5N6)V7according to technical specificationspromptly providedworks very welleasy to usewell executed and finished

Reviews.Title: It's OK!
Reviews.Author: griner
Reviews.Content: This keyboard is "OK". You get what you pay for. You buy cheap, you get cheap! If you want something that is more better, "Pay More". It's Just that simple.

Reviews.Title: Good cheap keyboard and mouse combo
Reviews.Author: Chad
Reviews.Content: Everything is fine with this combo if you are looking for a cheap connected keyboard and mouse combo.  The reason I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 is the enter button on the keyboard and the back slash are different than most keyboards and it took me a little while to get used to it.  The enter button is shorter and the backslash is up one row than it is normally on keyboards, so where I would normally hit the enter key with my pinky, the backslash button was there instead.  Besides that, it works just fine.

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: Owen
Reviews.Content: Such an excellent product, at a very low price!!!! I would suggest this to all computer users, works great, thank you

Reviews.Title: Great item for the price and especially as a back ...
Reviews.Author: OregonFamily
Reviews.Content: Great item for the price and especially as a back up in case other keyboards die!!! I have used it on numerous occasions and cannot fault it

Reviews.Title: Very Basic
Reviews.Author: replay888 "replay888"
Reviews.Content: very basic keyboard and mouse --- I wanted to see what was on an old desktop before I got rid of it and needed but did not want to spend much.  Suited my needs.

Reviews.Title: not worth the money
Reviews.Author: David Herring "Amazon lover"
Reviews.Content: unless you want to buy a few of these so that you have spares when they mess up I wouldn't buy this one. it started out great but within 1 month i started having problems with this key board and mouse combo. the mouse skips a lot and the letters don't always work when you click them. not recommended.

Reviews.Author: skycutterx
Reviews.Content: arrived fast, well packed. this is the very first pc keyboard that i got so... for me it great, love it

Reviews.Title: Type, Type, Type
Reviews.Author: Michael J. Greener
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my wife. Her old keyboard was gummed up with chocolate, dust, dirt, gummy bears, paper clips, fingernail clippings, and cat hair. The new keyboard fixed all that, so she has nothing to gripe about now.

Reviews.Title: make sure it's for your set up.
Reviews.Author: kyuumu
Reviews.Content: It's exactly what it claims to be. JUST READ first so you don't make the same mistake I did. Unfortunately I could not use it.

Reviews.Title: works great!
Reviews.Author: Eva Bradley
Reviews.Content: Cheap, works good, nice color and seems to take a beating.  If you need a cheap replacement, this is your keyboard.

Reviews.Title: Good Feeling keyboard
Reviews.Author: Jordan Matthews
Reviews.Content: Keyboard and mouse work great, feel a little cheap, but for the price it is a good feeling keyboard and mouse.

Reviews.Title: Great keyboard for the money!
Reviews.Author: Miss Piggy
Reviews.Content: This is a great ps/2 keyboard.  I was having trouble with the wireless system and it was suggested that I try this keyboard.

Reviews.Title: DEVICE NOT FUNCTIONAL YET
Reviews.Author: tinmoorthy
Reviews.Content: DEVICE NOT FUNCTIONAL YETWhen connected to a laptoo over a PS2 -USB -- supplied thr' Amazonagain and that arrived just this afternoon, of 05 nov 2013 tuesday-- there is absolutely no reaction --- the test repeated overtwo more laptops yield the same observations --  2 out of 7failures is rather high - that of a keyboard & of a ATMEGA chip ---- plaese note there was no hot swap -- tinmoorthy 05 nov 2013 tue 1800 hrs

Reviews.Title: GREAT PRODUCT!
Reviews.Author: John Caruso
Reviews.Content: This came so fast I thought it was a mistake! The ease of operation,installation, and usefulness is overwhelming. I am using it right now to write this review!! Great product. A tremendous value for the money!!

Reviews.Title: You'd think a keyboard is a keyboard, but not this one...
Reviews.Author: Silva
Reviews.Content: I should have spent a little more to get a quality keyboard, but my main priority was to find a keyboard with some room above the "F" keys. I need to place a decal in that area for a specific application of the keyboard (old car alignment machine).The key presses don't always register. Great for someone that uses two fingers for typing, as the keys require considerably more effort to register a keystroke than any other keyboard I've used before. May consider returning it.

Reviews.Title: A very basic keyboard
Reviews.Author: Computer Geek "Computer Geek"
Reviews.Content: The first things I noticed were how light and loud this keyboard is.  Put it on a slick surface like a desktop and it will slide all over while you try to type.  Other than that it works fine and is a good value.

Reviews.Title: So far it has not mis-spelled a single word...
Reviews.Author: D. Osborne
Reviews.Content: I needed a USB keyboard for my repair bench, this one was a full keyboard and inexpensive.  It works fine on all OSs, light weight and easy to use.  I'm not sure the keypress style would be good for heavy typing, it has more of a laptop feel than the full key press of most keyboard.  But, for the price, who can complain.

Reviews.Title: "Incredibley Good Deal" on a replacement PS/2 computer keyboard!
Reviews.Author: CosmicX
Reviews.Content: A super value PC keyboard with spill resistance, soft-touch keys and a small size. Being it's in PS/2 format it frees up an extra USB port.

Reviews.Title: Bang for your buck!
Reviews.Author: Joshua Erece
Reviews.Content: Great buy for the price although the Enter button was awkward to press at first. Regardless of that awkwardness, it was perfect.

Reviews.Title: OK in a pinch, but not for actual typing
Reviews.Author: Carbonbased "Carbonbased"
Reviews.Content: I got this at the local computer store because it was the only one they had and I needed a keyboard that day.  Since then, I have ordered an AmazonBasics wired keyboard and will put this one back in the box for emergencies.  I don't need a compact board and this one has the keypad sections smooshed together to create a 17" footprint.  The most annoying thing is the 'Enter' key.  Unless you do a lot of scientific notation (or something,) you will also be annoyed at the placement of the \ | key on the home row to the right of the ' " key...where the 'Enter' key should start.  In order to make up for this, the 'Enter' key extends up into the row above.  It's just odd.

Reviews.Title: Works functionally but hard to type on.
Reviews.Author: Andrew Smith
Reviews.Content: Functionally I love this keyboard, has all the buttons I wanted, but the feel of the keys is too difficult to get used to for typing. You have to press the keys relatively hard to make it work. The keys are loud too. The springs under the keys are too tight. But I have small hands, so if youre heavy handed, this'll be a perfect slimline keyboard for you.

Reviews.Title: Arrived quickly and in good condition
Reviews.Author: Michael Song
Reviews.Content: Does what it says it does, not much more to say than that. Good value for good price. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: Very basic and simple.
Reviews.Author: Chris Butler
Reviews.Content: Easy keyboard to use, the noise is medium level. The keyboard installs itself, thanks for relief. It even works on Windows 7. The keyboard is about light as paper.

Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for, but this one is alright
Reviews.Author: P. Edmon Graham
Reviews.Content: Don't expect much from this cheap keyboard. It works and it comes in a million configurations, which is very nice. It's not great to use and feels cheap though, so don't expect much more than a good emergency or secondary keyboard. If you're actually planning on using this full time, you're best to spend more money and check out a mechanical keyboard with better switches.

Reviews.Title: Worst Keyboard Ever
Reviews.Author: David B
Reviews.Content: This is probably the worst keyboard I have ever seen. There is something wrong with the space bar; it takes about 5 pounds of pressure to press it, and the Enter key is only slightly better. I knew I was getting a cheap keyboard, and the mushy-ness of the keys is about what I expected, but the hard-to-press keys are intolerable. I'm glad that I only bought it to get my cart total above the free shipping limit, so I'm only out a dollar or two.

Reviews.Title: Good for the price
Reviews.Author: Eric Robbins
Reviews.Content: This was an inexpensive combo, but does exactly what it needs to. Not the greatest feel on the keyboard, but very adequate.

Reviews.Title: Arrived dead.
Reviews.Author: Georgia L. Jones
Reviews.Content: This keyboard did not work at all. Took it to a repair shop to try on different computers and got same result. Computers did not even recognize that a keyboard was plugged in. Not worth paying the postage to send it back.

Reviews.Title: Decent, Well Priced Product
Reviews.Author: S. Vance
Reviews.Content: A decent keyboard with low-profile keys.  I gave it only 4 stars, because the keys are a bit stiff.  However, it is a good quality product with an excellent price tag.

Reviews.Title: Better than expected
Reviews.Author: VaporEyes
Reviews.Content: Works great right out of the box, comes with batterys too. Keys are Silent and press softly.Mouse also has two buttons on the left side near your thumb. Great price, great product 8/14/13.

Reviews.Title: Great for the price
Reviews.Author: Amber N. Meredith
Reviews.Content: You have to hit the buttons harder than my previous keyboard, meaning I often skip over some letters when I type. But I've only had the set for a few days. They are lightweight, which is good, but sometimes they feel almost empty, haha. I've had no problems, and overall I'm very pleased.

Reviews.Title: great
Reviews.Author: Matt
Reviews.Content: thank you. works well. great for the price. will def order more again in the future. delivered as described. thanks.

Reviews.Title: Ordered 7 - many complaints
Reviews.Author: Mark
Reviews.Content: I ordered 7 of these for a client to use in a virtualized classroom environment I was setting up. One set was USB (even though the box said PS/2), one keyboard half the buttons did not one, one mouse had oxidation on the pins and would not function properly (actually caused my virtualization host to lock up), one mouse had a broken left click. I was VERY unhappy with this product and will never purchase this brand again. It put my project a week behind and made both me and my client very upset.

Reviews.Title: Cheap
Reviews.Author: luk
Reviews.Content: For the money I guess it is ok. My main complaint is that a lot of the keys get stuck or feel sticky and a few of the key caps are mislabeled some how? I am not sure why, I would not recommend this keyboard. I suggest you spend a little more money on a decent keyboard.

Reviews.Title: First one received with defective keyboard. Multiple keys don't work.
Reviews.Author: L. M. Sharp
Reviews.Content: Keyboard has defective keys on right side. The enter key, Numlock, and the period key among others were all inoperative. Trying for an exchange, but we'll see.

Reviews.Title: Standard?
Reviews.Author: NC
Reviews.Content: The enter key throws me off so bad, but its nothing i can't get used to.Biggest plus is that there has been absolutely NO ghosting problems with it! I play MMOs and its perfect.minus the enter key*

Reviews.Title: Screwy key arrangement
Reviews.Author: PapaChop
Reviews.Content: It isn't terrible, but the small enter key and the way the backslash is placed makes it way too easy to hit the backslash instead of (or in addition to) the enter key. The key feel is decent for the price.

Reviews.Title: excellent product
Reviews.Author: Bo Lester
Reviews.Content: excellent product but was not as informative of the details of product design on line as some of other products offered.

Reviews.Title: Cheap combo, good quality.
Reviews.Author: Kevin
Reviews.Content: Inexpensive mouse and keyboard setup. They don't feel too cheap for the price and they work well. FYI, I bought two and have had no issues.

Reviews.Title: Good for the money, but buy a better keyboarrd
Reviews.Author: Andy
Reviews.Content: Honestly, its good for what it costs but just buy a better keyboard unless you want it not functioning properly from time to time.

Reviews.Title: Gets the job done
Reviews.Author: S Reviewer
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my pc for general use and gaming. I didn't want anything special so I went with this. It is standard but it works good.

Reviews.Title: Its a keyboard
Reviews.Author: Jose Celedon
Reviews.Content: The only downside is the short cable on the keyboard. other than that, works great. I use it for xbox 360 and ps3

Reviews.Title: Content
Reviews.Author: S. Choquette
Reviews.Content: I LOVE these slim styled keyboards. So much easier and appealing to the eyes. If your computer monitor is not a flat screen and weighs more then 100 lbs. then this product might not be for you.

Reviews.Title: Works well
Reviews.Author: J. Wooster
Reviews.Content: We purchased this USB keyboard to connect to a laptop that was having keyboard issues.  It works well and we would purchased again.

Reviews.Title: Ok Product
Reviews.Author: Cary M Castleberry
Reviews.Content: For the price, they work. Customers break them faster then I can replace them no mater the brand or how much I paid.

Reviews.Title: I like it
Reviews.Author: 'Bill'
Reviews.Content: I'm happy with this keyboard, but they do seem to have a few keys in odd positions, so it might be more frustrating for a touch-typist but it's not an issue for me. It's fairly quiet as well.

Reviews.Title: Works great for a cheap keyboard
Reviews.Author: Elton Rattan
Reviews.Content: I only bought this as my laptop keypad gets hot.This product works well, keys are soft and works well.The middle area is quite small, but when compared with the laptop it is better anyway

Reviews.Title: Can't beat this little guy for the price!
Reviews.Author: Ryan K. "ryanweb"
Reviews.Content: Didn't know what to expect given how inexpensive this is, but the keyboard is instantly recognized on Windows 7 and has a nice key feel. If I ever need an extra keyboard again, I'll definitely buy another.

Reviews.Title: This PS/2 Keyboard/Mouse combination does the job...
Reviews.Author: Ernest C. Upchurch
Reviews.Content: I still have a couple of computer that require the PS/2 mouse and keyboard connection. This combination does the job well.

Reviews.Title: Cheap, basic, works well
Reviews.Author: Firebug24k
Reviews.Content: Bought it because I needed a PS/2 keyboard in a hurry.  Exactly as a described - lightweight, perfect as a backup or spare for a server.

Reviews.Title: Works Great.
Reviews.Author: Kevin S
Reviews.Content: Works great. Wireless Keyboard and mouse. Do I need to say more. Works really well. I'm required to type more. Ok thats enough. 8^)

Reviews.Title: perfect functionality
Reviews.Author: tyjo26
Reviews.Content: So cheap,  yet so simple and perfect. This keyboard is worth the buy if you need a temporary replacement. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: What I expected
Reviews.Author: Mark
Reviews.Content: I needed a USB keyboard for my laptop and this fit the bill. Maybe the keys are a little stiff, but I expected that. For this kind of money and not expecting high-end performance (such as that for a media keyboard), this is perfect. No complaints.

Reviews.Title: great
Reviews.Author: berrde47
Reviews.Content: my laptop computer keyboard gave up so I got this one, works nice and like the layout, will buy another if needed

Reviews.Title: Disaster
Reviews.Author: John C. Jamason
Reviews.Content: This product has little to NO power at all. It takes FOREVER to connect if it does at all. At times you have to try multiple ports before you get it to work. I have tried it on multiple computers and have the same problem with all of them. Do not waist your money!

Reviews.Title: great for the price
Reviews.Author: Mohammad
Reviews.Content: great for the price It does the workit's not the best in the world but I like it for the price

Reviews.Title: Perfect !!
Reviews.Author: Kody A Crouch
Reviews.Content: This is the perfect size for my backpack. I've used the mouse and keyboard for almost a year and both are in great shape. I am a professional programmer, so I type thousands of words per day, and no signs of wear and tear other than the 'A' fading out on the key.I will buy another one if they offer one with no number pad.

Reviews.Title: Well its a keyboard
Reviews.Author: David W. Cook
Reviews.Content: Well its a keyboard. Light weight. Cheaply made. I used it once and feel I got my moneys worth. Sometimes USB doesn't cut it.

Reviews.Title: Good Keyboard
Reviews.Author: KISSfn
Reviews.Content: Bought this as a gift for someone (not me)! who spilled a drink on their laptop keyboard.  It works fine and the laptop is usable again.

Reviews.Title: Great value
Reviews.Author: B. Blair
Reviews.Content: This wireless keyboard and mouse was a simple plug and play! No problems, works GREAT Great value! I recomend it.

Reviews.Title: Good buy for the money
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: In the past I have purchased cheap keyboard for for my kids from Wal-Mart. The saying you get what you pay for definitely applies. This keyboard however beats my Wal-Mart keyboards in both price and quality. If you want a simple keyboard this is the one to buy.

Reviews.Title: A lot better than I expected
Reviews.Author: ADV
Reviews.Content: I just wanted a basic keyboard so that I wouldn't ruin my laptop keyboard at home with intensive use. This keyboard hasn't given me any problem so far. I can also play games with this keyboard. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: It works
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This is an old school larger keyboard.  I got it to replace the silicone keyboard I had bought for my laptop, the silicone was too hard to type with.  It's larger and takes up more space on my desk but i like the way it types.  The only reason it didn't get 5 starts is because the letter "p" is rubbed off the key.

Reviews.Title: You have a better alternative with cheaper price-
Reviews.Author: M. Liu "Compare before you buy!!!"
Reviews.Content: You have a better alternative with cheaper price-please see the link below. This one is little bit stiff. You can buy the following onehttp://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B0038M3YM8/ref=wms_ohs_product

Reviews.Title: Defective and odd keyboard layout
Reviews.Author: Kevin B
Reviews.Content: The keyboard has an odd layout for the enter button which is annoying, but I suppose you could adjust to it.However, this keyboard arrived with 3 different dead keys that would not recognize at all. The mouse on the other hand seemed fine.

Reviews.Title: Broken Keys
Reviews.Author: mw
Reviews.Content: The keyboard arrived and I immediately noticed that the "o" key and the "k" key had to pressed down hard for it actually to register. This becomes very annoying when typing.Other than that it works great, its a little loud though, but I didn't expect much considering it was around $12.

Reviews.Title: This works and keystrokes are sturdy
Reviews.Author: cga
Reviews.Content: For its price, i am pretty content with the quality. Had a old keyboard that the keys felt wobbling. This one sounded rather comfortable and does what it was supposed to

Reviews.Title: Mouse died after 2 months
Reviews.Author: Phil A.
Reviews.Content: Mouse died, new batteries didn't help. Good deal, too good to be true, and here I am.  I'll get a better brand next time.

Reviews.Title: What a Deal -- Get Two!
Reviews.Author: Daniel Attila "Daniel Attila"
Reviews.Content: This is a kick-ass, slim keyboard that is technically free. You'll love typing on it, and you'll type fast. Only a Mac keyboard could beat this.

Reviews.Title: V7 USB Multimedia Keyboard KM0Z1-5N6P
Reviews.Author: Jeff Lutz
Reviews.Content: I am really pleased with this. The keys feel good and are a flat low profile design that minimizes junk getting under them.I like the short cut media keys and the way they are layed out. I plugged the keyboard in and all worked as assigned (Win7).Well worth the price!

Reviews.Title: excellent product
Reviews.Author: mike myers
Reviews.Content: Need a good mouse keyboard Congo for gaming system I built, they both performed great would buy again highly reqmended

Reviews.Title: Broken Keys
Reviews.Author: Xretsim
Reviews.Content: The feel and look of the keyboard was nice but when I plugged in the keyboard, not all the keys work such as "n" "backspace" and others.

Reviews.Title: Didn't work because of the port.
Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: The port on the system was damaged and I wasn't able to use it. I would recommend going with usb keyboards as they are easier to insert.

Reviews.Title: Rounded plug in from 10 years back
Reviews.Author: maria bautista
Reviews.Content: Rounded plug in from 10 years back, will only work with old computers. I should have read the the compatibility.

Reviews.Title: They are as advertised
Reviews.Author: Skeletonkey IFOR
Reviews.Content: They do what they are supposed to do, on some computers. Not really plug n play seeing as how they don't work on all computers and don't have any install disks, its basically trial and error, and they're so cheap there is really no point in sending them back.

Reviews.Title: Unsatisfactory Compared to the Logitech Compact Keyboard
Reviews.Author: Paul Moreau "handyman"
Reviews.Content: Compact?  Compared to the keyboard I got with my Dell desktop, this keyboard is only 1.5 inches less side to side and 2.5 inches more front to back.  It is about a half inch larger in both dimensions than the no longer available Logitech compact keyboard.Like the Logitech keyboard, the V7 has no extra space between the function keys and the numeric keys.  Given the deeper front to back size of both of these keyboards, it is difficult to understand this lack of the normal separation of these rows of keys.  Both keyboards lack the grouping of the function keys into groups of four.Again, like the Logitech keyboard, The applications menu key has been moved from the right side of the spacebar to the left.  The windows key is now the third key from the left rather than the second key as it is normally.  The difference in these keys is that the Logitech keyboard marks the windows key with a raised bump to help distinguish it.  The V7 keyboard lacks that distinction.A major difference between the V7 and the Logitech keyboard can be found in the cursor pad.  Logitech chose to use smaller slim keys for this purpose thus creating a cursor pad with a smaller footprint but with a bit more separation between it and the keyboard and numeric keypad.  The V7 uses normal size keys for this purpose, making them a bit closer to the adjacent keyboard and numeric pad and quite a bit more difficult to identify by touch.The V7 arranged the page up/down, home/end and insert/delete keys between the keyboard and the numeric pad.  The keys are in two columns of three.  Logitech moved these keys above the numeric keypad.  Neither positioning is very good.  With either keyboard, I tend to use the numeric keypad for these functions rather than trying to quickly find the misplaced keys.  While this is a toss up, Logitech did gain the advantage of not trying to squeeze these keys into the usual position and was able to provide a slightly larger separation between key groups in this area.The V7 keyboard has special Microsoft applications keys above the keypad.  Since these keys start applications, I'd prefer that they not be positioned where they may be hit while attempting to use the numeric keypad.  I much prefer the choice that Logitech made in using this area for the page up/down and home/end keys.While the key spacing of the V7 is normal, the key tops are not.  They are very flat and larger than normal.  There is very little space between keys.  This increases the tendency to miss the center of the keys, causing them to sometimes be hard to press.  The smaller gap between keys seems to increase the problem of junk making the keys stick and much harder to shake the junk out to unstick them.  I've had had a much greater problem with stuck keys on the V7 than I've had with any other keyboard I've used.  The little nub on the F and J keys are quite small, making them hard to feel when positioning your fingers on the keyboard.While the V7 keyboard is heavier than I've grown accustomed to, that added weight doesn't seem to indicate better quality.  Of the three keyboards I purchased, one was DOA.  Two columns of keys didn't function - the column of keys that include the 6 and 7 keys.  Add to that the tendency for keys on the V7 to stick, and you've got a very unsatisfactory product.All in all, I much prefer the Logitech keyboard to the V7.  Logitech seems to produce a higher quality product with far better ergonomics.  While I would like a good compact keyboard, the V7 just won't do.March 14, 2013:I had to drag out one of the surviving keyboards six months after replacing them with a very basic Logitech keyboard.  I found the keyboard so difficult to use that I'm trashing them and getting a couple of Logitech basic keyboards as my spares.

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY THIS ITEM
Reviews.Author: Van
Reviews.Content: horrible do not buy. normal keyboards are a LOT better. please fo not buy this item for it is a waste of money.

Reviews.Title: no mouse
Reviews.Author: engr
Reviews.Content: This item is has pictures of both a keyboard and a mouse, but item is keyboard only; seems like a little bit of false advertising. Returned to reorder keyboard and mouse package.

ProductInfo.Features:
Keyboard and mouse combo with PS/2 connectors
Full-size 104-key keyboard
Plug and play, no drivers needed
ProductInfo.Name: V7 Standard PS/2 Keyboard and Mouse Combo (CK0A2-4N6P)
